full_text: 2018/KER/271 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE B.KEMAL PASHA THURSDAY, THE 4TH DAY OF JANUARY 2018 / 14TH POUSHA, 1939 Cr1.MC.No. 8827 of 2017 SC 787/2016 OF ASSISTANT SESSIONS COURT, (ADDITIONAL) PALAKKAD CRIME NO. 619/2016 OF NENMARA POLICE STATION , PALAKKAD PETITIONER (S) /ACCUSED 1 TO 7 1 RAJESH.R., AGED 20 YEARS, S/O.RADHAKRISHNAN, THIRUTHAMPADAM HOUSE, POTHUNDI, NENMARA P.O., PALAKKAD DISTRICT-678508. 2 SAJITH, AGED 20 YEARS, S/O.GURUVAYOORAPPAN, PARIKKAL HOUSE, PANANGATTIRI, ELAVANCHERI, PALAKKAD DISTRICT-678508. 3 SHAFFEQ, AGED 19 YEARS, S/O.HANEEFA, VAKKAV HOUSE, NENMARA P.O., CHITTUR TALUK, PALAKKAD DISTRICT-678508. 4 KESHAVANUNNI , AGED 20 YEARS, S/O.CHANDRASEKHARAN, THEKKEMARIYIL HOUSE, PARUTHIPPULLI, ALATHUR, PALAKKAD DISTRICT-678573. 5 ASHIQ, AGED 19 YEARS,S/O.SIVADASAN, CHINGANTHODI HOUSE, KONNANCHERI, AYAKKAD, VADAKKANCHERI, PALAKKAD DISTRICT-678683. 6 ATHUL, AGED 19 YEARS, S/O.SASI, ATHUL NIVAS, PUTHIYANKAM P.O., PALAKKAD DISTRICT-678541. 7 ADARSH, AGED 20 YEARS, S/O.UDHAYABALAN, ACHUTHA NIVAS, VADAVANNOOR, KOLLANGODE, PALAKKAD DISTRICT-678506. BY ADV.SRI.A.HAROON RASHEED RESPONDENT (S) /COMPLAINANT AND STATE: 1. STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY THE SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE, NENMARA POLICE STATION, PALAKKAD DISTRICT, THROUGH THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM. BS atte Cr1.MC.No. 8827 of 2017 () 2018/KER/271 2. SOORAJ, AGED 19 YEARS, S/O.CHANDRAN, RESIDING AT GEETHA NIVAS, VADAKKUMPADAM, KODUVAYUR P.O., PALAKKAD DISTRICT-678201. R1 BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI ALEX M THOMBRA R2 BY ADV. SRI.C.R.REKHESH SHARMA THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 04-01-2018, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: K.V. 2018/KER/271 Crl.MC.No. 8827 of 2017 () APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' ANNEXURES ANNEXURE Al THE TRUE COPY OF THE F.I.R. IN CRIME NO.619/2016 OF NENMARA POLICE STATION. ANNEXURE A2 THE TRUE COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT/CHARGE SHEET IN CRIME NO.619/2016 OF NENMARA POLICE STATION. ANNEXURE A3 THE TRUE COPY OF THE AFFIDAVIT SIGNED BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT. RESPONDENTS ANNEXURES: NIL /TRUE COPY/ K.V. P.S.TO JUDGE Pip asl abe 2018/KER/271 B. KEMAL PASHA, J. Dated this the 4" day of January, 2018 ORDER Petitioners are the accused in S.C. No.787/2016 of the Assistant Sessions Court(Additional), Palakkad, which has arisen from Crime No.619/2016 of Nenmara Police Station, for the offences punishable under Sections 143, 147, 148, 341, 323, 324 and 308 read with Section 149 IPC. 2. It seems that the matter has been amicably settled between the parties. 3. On going through the matter, this Court is satisfied that there are no ingredients to invite an offence under Section 308 IPC in the matter. The 2 respondent, who is the de facto complainant, has filed Annexure-A3 affidavit, affirming that the matter has been amicably settled between him and the petitioners and he has no complaints against the petitioners. DLs 2018/KER/271 Crl.M.C.8827/2017 >. 4. When the matter has been amicably settled between the parties, no purpose would be served in proceeding with the matter any further. Matters being so, all further proceedings against the petitioners in S.C. No.787/2016 of the Assistant Sessions Court(Additional), Palakkad, which has arisen from Crime No.619/2016 of Nenmara Police Station, can be quashed. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and all further proceedings against the petitioners in S.C. No.787/2016 of the Assistant Sessions Court(Additional), Palakkad, which has arisen from Crime No.619/2016 of Nenmara_ Police Station, are quashed. Sd/- (B.KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE) aks/04/01 // True Copy // PS to Judge
